citation.article-title: Methylosphaera hansonii gen. nov., sp. nov., a psychrophilic, group I methanotroph from Antarctic marine-salinity, meromictic lakes.

p.s: Methylosphaera (Me.thy.lo.sphae'ra. Fr. n. méthyle the methyl group ; Gr. fem. n. spaira a sphere; ML fem. n. Methylosphaera methyl sphere)
Spherical cells, single or in pairs, about 1.5-2.0 μm in diameter.
Resting cells, including cysts and exospores, are not formed.
Phylogenetically related to the family Methylococcaceae in the gamma subdivision of the Proteobacteria.
Contains one species, Methylosphaera hansonii, which includes the type strain.
Habitats are the chemocline zones and edge surface sediments of Antarctic marine-salinity, meromictic lakes.
